designScenario.name: Speed Brake System
designScenario.description: The Speed Brake System is an aerodynamically actuated system designed to deploy and retract speed brake panels on the aircraft's wings or fuselage to increase drag and reduce airspeed during flight. It operates in coordination with flight control systems to manage deceleration during approach, landing, or in-flight maneuvers. The system ensures controlled deployment angles, symmetrical operation, and structural integrity under high aerodynamic loads. It incorporates redundancy, fail-safe mechanisms, and real-time monitoring to prevent asymmetric deployment and maintain stability. The design prioritizes rapid response, minimal mechanical wear, and compatibility with hydraulic or electromechanical actuation systems.

details.description: Deploy and retract speed brake panels symmetrically to modulate aerodynamic drag without inducing yaw or roll moments.
Integrate with flight control computers to adjust deployment angles based on airspeed, altitude, and phase of flight.
Achieve full deployment of speed brake panels within 1 second of command initiation.
Synchronize panel movement across all actuators with a maximum asymmetry tolerance of ±0.5°.
Implement dual hydraulic or redundant electromechanical actuators to ensure retraction capability during primary system failure.
Detect and alert asymmetrical deployment or jamming via position feedback sensors.
Design panels and actuators to withstand >200,000 deployment cycles without degradation in performance.
Use corrosion-resistant alloys and seals to ensure operation in environments ranging from -50°C to +70°C.

systemComponents.name: Speed Brake Panels
systemComponents.description: Aerodynamically shaped surfaces mounted on the wings or fuselage, designed to extend into the airflow to increase drag.

subComponents.name: Panel Hinges
subComponents.description: High-load bearings enabling smooth deployment/retraction while resisting aerodynamic forces.

subComponents.name: Composite Panels
subComponents.description: Lightweight, high-stiffness composite structures with erosion-resistant coatings.

systemComponents.name: Actuation Mechanism
systemComponents.description: Hydraulic or electromechanical actuators providing force to deploy/retract speed brake panels.

subComponents.name: Linear Actuators
subComponents.description: Electro-hydraulic servo actuators converting hydraulic pressure or electric power into linear motion.

subComponents.name: Mechanical Linkages
subComponents.description: Rigid pushrods and bell cranks transmitting actuator force to the panels.

systemComponents.name: Control Module
systemComponents.description: Electronic unit processing commands from flight computers and monitoring sensor feedback.

subComponents.name: Deployment Logic Controller
subComponents.description: FPGA-based processor executing deployment sequencing and symmetry checks.

subComponents.name: Power Distribution Unit
subComponents.description: Manages electrical power to electromechanical actuators and sensors.

systemComponents.name: Position Sensors
systemComponents.description: Linear variable differential transformers (LVDTs) or resolvers providing real-time panel position feedback.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Power Supply
systemComponents.description: Dedicated hydraulic pump and reservoir providing pressurized fluid to hydraulic actuators (if applicable).

relationships.description: The Flight Control Computer sends deployment commands and receives status updates from the Speed Brake System's Control Module.
The Actuation Mechanism is physically and functionally integral to the operation of the Speed Brake Panels.
Hydraulic actuators rely on continuous pressurized fluid supply from the Hydraulic Power Supply.
Position Sensors provide real-time feedback to the Control Module for closed-loop deployment control.

relationships.target: Speed Brake Panels, Actuation Mechanism, Control Module
relationships.description: The Speed Brake System aggregates mechanical, actuation, and control components into a cohesive operational unit.

attributes.name: deploymentTime
attributes.description: Maximum allowable time from command initiation to full panel deployment.

attributes.name: actuationForce
attributes.description: Minimum force capacity of actuators to overcome aerodynamic loads during deployment.

attributes.name: operationalTemperature
attributes.description: Certified operating temperature range for all mechanical and electronic components.

attributes.name: materialStrength
attributes.value: High-strength aluminum alloys (≥400 MPa yield) with titanium hinges
attributes.description: Structural materials for panels and load-bearing components.

attributes.name: asymmetryTolerance
attributes.description: Maximum permissible differential between left/right panel deployment angles.

comments.body: Redundant actuator design: Dual hydraulic channels with mechanical load sharing. Position feedback via quad-redundant LVDTs with median-voting.
